Los supervivientes son pura estetica (no como los killers), enfermera y la chica fantasma (asi le llamo yo) te dan 5 tipos de canceres, encima de que escaparte de ellas es super chungo y espera si te sale un campero, pero si tienes alguna idea de como trolear , les ganas facil. Si acabas de empezar utiliza a Claudete ella tiene una habilidad de las mejores del juego que es autocuracion, y desde ese punto ya puedes hacer algunas modificaciones. 
No te asustes con el tama√±o e duracion de la red de sangre si le dedicas horas te lo pasas bien y haces puntos, hacer siempre los desafios no seas vago sudoroso. Jugar contra demogorgon es la repera. 
Animos, quiero ver como pateas killer o Supervivientes, si eso mi culo tambien 7u7

Ai... como explicar Dead By Daylight, um jogo de survivor muito divertido nas primeiras horas, quando completei 100 horas se tornou massante, extressante, o jogo em quest√£o apresenta diversos bugs que assim como outros jogos a empresa responsavel n√£o est√° disposta a resolver, ataques de killers que pegam a distancia, vantagens do sobrevivente que nao funciona, alem de mapas extremamente escuros aonde voc√™ precisa deixar a luminosidade no maximo, n√£o recomendo esse jogo pois mesmo que ele seja cheio de defeitos, e divertido jogar com os amigos famoso "SWF" aonde √© possivel passar informa√ß√µes e deixar aquele killer camper na m√£o

I have always had ups and downs with this game. I remember getting the game, having fun, then getting more into the entire perk balance bullshit, ignoring the state of the game and trying to just mess around with friends. So now after 400 and something hours I feel like I can actually put my thoughts into words.

Picking up this game feels good in the beginning because you discover all the perks, learn how to play as a killer or how to play against all the killers and then learn the maps. The sense of discovery and learning something new is actually great when it comes to DBD. Especially picking up killer is really fun in the beginning since you can really feel when you get better and when everything clicks into place.

Then you start to get frustrated and see the flaws which persist to this current day. Massive maps that make some killers feel completely helpless, out of all these perks in the entire game literally only 10 for both survivor and killer are usable because they are the current meta, bugs that break entire maps or perks and now the biggest point MMR. MMR is probably the worst thing that could have happened to this game because it just does not work properly and doesnt consider all the different factors that go into DBD. The win conditions arent clear ingame though it is common knowledge that only escapes, kills and time ingame are considered for MMR. The game does not recognize good looping, survival, how many objectives you did and so on. The mindset of players changed to the negative and shows itself in very few if any altruistic plays from other survivors or killers tunneling and facecamping more than ever before.

So in its current state I can only recommend DBD as a casual game you play with friends. Though you might just have a better time playing a different game.

When playing as a killer, a tremendous amount of strategy is required, while when playing as a survivor, not so much strategy is required. This is a little unfair.
Killers will be agitated by Survivors, which can be frustrating while you're getting used to it.

If you want to win at Survivor, use voice chat with four people.

addicting if u like horror and the kick of being scarred, other then that, the devs pretty much dont listen to their players and contonue to just patch bugs out and bring new ones in, we have had one new map since juli 2021 when i started playing, but 3 new killers got added aswell as 50 thousand new cosmetics to keep the collectors in the game. i have spent so much money no this game just to develop a love hate relationship with this game. i really love it, but i cant defend the devs anymore.  

i really hope the upcoming competition of VHS and Outlast trials wakes BHVR up a bit again and the actually try and fix the game properly.

I love this game and I hate it.

I will warn anyone looking to play it that the grind to unlock all perks can take a very long time, especially if you don't want to drop ¬£¬£¬£ on all the DLC. You'll have to wait for perks to appear in the Shrine of Secrets.

That said, I still have fun on this game, although it's 10x better if you have friends to just mess around with rather than taking it too seriously. I prefer to run "fun" builds and try mess around rather than "win" every game.
